Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses feeling creatively stuck and desires to write more material and perform at an open mic night.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has been busy with work, feeling pressure from deadlines, and acknowledges the need to set boundaries around work hours.
Psychosocial History: The patient values connections with friends, particularly a best friend who provides support and lifts their spirits.
Mental Health Observations: The patient reports feeling more at ease after spending time outdoors but also experiences intrusive thoughts about work.
Progress Evaluation: The patient is becoming more aware of their thoughts and coping strategies, indicating positive progress.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient has implemented some coping strategies, such as going for walks, and is open to exploring structured scheduling.
Next Steps: The patient is encouraged to reach out to friends more often and set a small goal for writing new material.
